The claim made by Democratic U: S. Senate candidate Russ Feingold is that Ron Johnson "helped companies ship jobs overseas."
The Feingold campaign cited three votes: Panama, and Colombia as evidence to back the claim.
An August 2016 report by the nonpartisan: negative trade balance with South Korea had grown since the trade deal was signed, but the report did not provide estimates on jobs.
The left: leaning Economic Policy Institute estimated in May 2016 that trade deficits with Korea eliminated over 95,000 U.S. jobs between 2011 and 2015, but the report did not explicitly state that these jobs were sent overseas.
